messages.message:
This is so weird, I added an alias in `~/.bashrc` which was recognized. This aliased command involved `git commit`  but it gave this error: `/usr/bin/env: 'python': No such file or directory`

However, when I `source ~/.bashrc` manually I was able to run the command (and consequently git commit successfully). I wonder what the issue could be
I wonder if python isn't "set up" when bashrc is sourced on the system being resumed but it is when I ssh into the machine
